page.title: 02FARMING,WADE MARSH I.O.T.
page.content: Farming in Thanet is a very intensive industry which results in up to three crops being raised in a year. These consist of wheat, barley, brassicas and root crops raised in rotational succession to make the best use of the fertile soil. The farmland has been created by the drainage of wetland and then protected from marine inundation which had occurred several times in the past, notably in 1953 in recent years. There was also some salt impregnation about 1979 and the land took about six years to recover and come into production again.
